message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public Fraction(String fractionString) {
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(fractionString, "/()", false);
    String numeratorString = st.nextToken();
    String denominatorString = st.nextToken();
    numerator = Integer.parseInt(numeratorString);
    denominator = Integer.parseInt(denominatorString);
}
<<<explanation>>>: Yes, you can modify the delimiter string in the StringTokenizer constructor to include both "/" and "()" to ignore parentheses while reading in fractions. By setting the third parameter of the constructor to false, the delimiters will be treated as separate tokens and not included in the resulting tokens.
